moves.1. d4: !   for me was very important to not let black any chance to get infinitive.
moves.1... Nf6 2. c4 g6 3. Nc3 d5: He chooses Grunfeld Defence which can be very tactical if white want. However I want to outplay your opponent in more positional waters.
moves.4. Nf3 Bg7 5. e3: excellent move to get my opponent rout of well known variation
moves.5... O-O 6. cxd5: Be2 or Qb3 are also possible but they lead to other schemes
moves.6... Nxd5 7. Bc4: This was my idea white chase the king and have pawn on e3 instant e4 which give more solid center.
moves.7... Nxc3: I think Nb6 was stronger.Capture on c3 is common in Grunfeld but here white center is more protected
moves.8. bxc3 c5 9. O-O Nc6: Normal looking move lead to  disaster!Qc7 is better bust still white keep some safe edge.
moves.10. Ba3: !   The improvement over game Yaroslav Djakuzov vs Martin Vassilev where play Qe2 which give some edge but black is still  holding.
moves.10... b6: cxd4 allow white press queen side easy with qe2 rfc1 rab1
moves.11. dxc5: !! this was a move  that black has missed.Now the are simple positionally lost.
moves.11... Bxc3 12. Rc1 Qxd1: This worsen think but black position is extreme unpleasant anyway.
moves.13. Rfxd1 Bb4 14. Bxb4 Nxb4 15. a3: c6 is also possible and maybe stronger
moves.15... Nc6: Great mistake black should play Na6.
moves.20. Nd4: I wasn't   sure to between ne5 and nd4 but it not matter too much.Pawn on 7 row is decisive the rest of game not need comment.
